meanings.sent1: The capturer caught the butterfly gently in their net.
meanings.sent2: The animal capturer rescued the lost dog from the forest.
meanings.sent3: The capturer was so skilled, they caught a fish with their bare hands!
meanings.sent4: She was a capturer of hearts, winning over everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The capturer of dreams, he painted vivid pictures with his words.

meanings.definition: To take someone or something as a prisoner or to take control of something by force.
meanings.sent1: The police had to capturer the criminal before he could escape.
meanings.sent2: The evil sorcerer tried to capturer the princess and rule the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The capturer of cookies was caught red-handed in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The capturer of attention, she commanded the room with her presence.
meanings.sent5: The capturer of opportunities, he seized every chance that came his way.

meanings.definition: To record or take a photograph of something.
meanings.sent1: The photographer aimed to capturer the beauty of the sunset in her shot.
meanings.sent2: He wanted to capturer the moment forever, so he took a picture.
meanings.sent3: The capturer of memories, she snapped photos at every family gathering.
meanings.sent4: The capturer of light, he framed the scene perfectly in his camera.
meanings.sent5: The capturer of smiles, she captured joy in every photo she took.
